commitResults.messageTitle: Standardize multiple references to the same footnote (#976)
commitResults.messageBody:
Multiple references to the same footnote (e.g. footnote 1) now look like

[1]
[1:1]
[1:2]
...etc

Let's standardize them so they all just show `[1]` instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix main page syntax link (#1024)
Support line numbers for code blocks (#991)
Migrate to bootstrap-vue popovers (#1033)
Render plugins on dynamic resources (#1051)
Allow changing parameter properties (#1075)
Remove redundant file writing (#1090)
commitResults.messageBody:
We are writing to a temp path, and then reading it immediately.
Let's avoid this by passing the string directly instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add start from line number functionality to code blocks (#1115)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's do this by checking for the `start-from` attribute on a code block
and then set an inline style that sets the `line` counter to the 
appropriate value.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove OK button from modals (#1134)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's remove the redundant OK button from modals,
and only show it if the `ok-title` attribute is present.

commitResults.messageTitle: Show pointer and use underline dashed for click trigger (#1111)
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix a regression from #1033.

Let's add back the two styles of triggers:
- click: show mouse pointer to signal that it is clickable
  and use underline dashed
- not click: no special cursor, and use underline dotted

commitResults.messageTitle: Upgrade to bootstrap-vue 2.5.0 (#1085)
Parse popovers for footnotes (#1155)
commitResults.messageBody:
During the migration to bootstrap-vue,
popovers had to be parsed into bootstrap-vue syntax.

This is done before the plugins stage, where footnotes are implemented, so the popovers don't work there.

Let's add the parsing of popovers to the footnotes plugin to solve this.

commitResults.messageTitle:
Use
to separate lines of code block (#1176)
Use border dotted for hover triggers (#1216)
Move constants to separate file
Add core library constants and improve quality
Correct file paths
Add feature-request issue template (#951)
Replace headers in test .md files with bold text (#954)
UserGuide: Document the use of icon-size in boxes (#1021)
Exclude *.md files from being copied over on build (#1010)
Allow using 'none' footer attribute in frontmatter (#1002)
Add copy code-block plugin (#1043)
Enable AppVeyor CI (#1040)
Custom timezone for built-in timestamp (#1073)
Remove dynamic include feature (#1037)
Fix hrefs for headings with angular brackets (#1089)
commitResults.messageBody:
```
The hrefs of headings with angular brackets are incorrect because
markdown-it escapes the characters to "<" and ">" and the
subsequent slugify operation converts it to "and-lt" or "and-gt".

Let's fix this by removing the occurrences of the strings 
"<" and ">" before the slugify operation
```

commitResults.messageTitle: Upgrade js-beautify and provide option to turn it off (#1116)
commitResults.messageBody:
MarkBind currently runs js-beautify v1.7.5, although later versions
of the library have been released (the latest version as of this PR
is v1.10.3).

Let's upgrade js-beautify to the latest version.

Turning off js-beautify can improve the performance of MarkBind's 
build process. Let's also give the user the option to turn off js-beautify (whenever
necessary) through an option in site.json.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add '_site' to the ignored folders in site.json (#1046)
Make highlighting bold (#1045)
Add pageNav to Using Plugins Page (#1062)
Add example for using multiple features in code-blocks (#1102)
commitResults.messageBody:
The user will have to try out how to add multiple features when using 
code blocks.

Let's add an example regarding how to use multiple features in code
blocks so that it's easier for the user to understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: Convert code in boxes to code block (#1086)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's convert <code> boxes to code blocks to better showcase the 
feature

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix pageNav in tweaking the page structure (#1127)
commitResults.messageBody:
The pageNav for tweaking the page structure is missing filter tags.

Let's fix the headings in filter tags and the pageNav so that pageNav
display filter tags appropriately.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug in Search for UG and DG (#1147)
Remove fixed bugs from test\functional\test_site\bugs\index.md` (#1148)
Document adding new site content in DG (#1153)
commitResults.messageBody:
New developers contributing a new feature to MarkBind have a hard time 
adding new content to the test site.

Let's add documentation regarding how to do so.

commitResults.messageTitle: User Guide: Fix link to user profile (#1197)
commitResults.messageBody:
The link to a contributor's profile is pointing to someone
else's profile.

Let's fix the link by pointing to the correct profile.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix typo in fullSyntaxReference (#1195)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a typo in fullSyntaxReference.md for the component
heading.

Let's fix the typo and add angular brackets to make it consistent
with the other components.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow stylelint to ignore test sites (#1011)
Add support for Octicons (#1000)
Fix octicon sizing (#1132)
Update UG with minimum required Node version (#953)
Update docs for light color scheme box (#977)
Fix fontawsome icons don't show underlines to indicate modal/tooltip (#1133)
Update docs and tests for heading addition to box (#952)
Allow live reloading for plugin defined sources (#955)
Update docs and tests for minimal panels addition (#960)
Update missing documentation for minimal panels (#961)
Fix plugin live reloading for relative file paths (#974)
commitResults.messageBody:
Relative file paths provided by plugins are not resolved against the
processed page or included file.

This results in live reloading failing for pages not in the root
directory.

Let's fix this, and also rewrite plugin source collection, allowing
plugins to simply define tags and corresponding source attributes
to watch.

This moves the logic for checking whether the source is part of an
included file to the main markbind repo, reducing potential code
duplication and simplifying the api.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix heading indexing for pure html headings
Update docs for fixing html heading indexing
Import markdown-it parser variant from /vue-strap
commitResults.messageBody:
Markdown-it in /vue-strap uses different plugins for parsing
its markdown content inside component attributes.

In preparation for moving markdown-it parsing to /markbind, let's move
the markdown-it variant from /vue-strap over to maintain parity with the
past markdown rendering behaviour for attributes in vue components.
Let's also restructure the directory hierarchy for markdown-it in here,
to reduce code duplication between the two variants.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement per component markdown attribute parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
Markdown passed in attributes are being rendered in the client.

This results in a dependency on the markdown parsing library
(markdown-it) on the client, bloating the resulting client bundle size.
It also slows webpage loading, especially on older devices.
Moreover, /markbind already parses some amount of markdown in attributes
for other purposes when building the site. This results in a less
cohesive codebase.

Let's move all markdown-it parsing from /vue-strap to /markbind,
passing the rendered html into vue slots.
Additionally, let's conveniently standardise the attribute naming for
these components at the same time.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adapt panel header indexing
commitResults.messageBody:
Markdown in attributes are now being parsed at build time.

Let’s adapt the panel header indexing, so that it appropriately
indexes the header in the correct slot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add unit tests for ComponentParser
Update input test files for attribute names update
Update expected test files
commitResults.messageBody:
Moving markdown parsing to build time results in markdown
in attributes being parsed into html in the dom.

Let’s update the expected test files to reflect these changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update docs for attribute name standardisation
Remove extra blank lines from page.njk output (#1005)
Restructure generated site data for searchbar ui (#1006)
commitResults.messageBody:
Keywords tied to a heading are appended to the heading with a prepending
'|' character.
This is so that the '|' character would serve as a visual separator
between the heading and the keyword.

However, it is thus not possible to extract a keyword from its heading
deterministically, as a heading can also include the '|' character.

Let's move the keywords to its own field, allowing the searchbar to
extract a heading's keyword from it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement box markdown header attributes parsing (#1025)
Refactor preprocess and url processing functions (#1026)
commitResults.messageBody:
The parser class houses a large number of functions.
This can be daunting for newer developers to the project, and decreases
maintainability of the code.

Let’s start by modularising the preprocess and url processing functions
into separate files.
Let’s also enhance some in-code documentation for these functions.
Some of these functions can also be abstracted into smaller units of
functionality, increasing the maintainability of the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement an api to ignore content in certain tags (#1047)
commitResults.messageBody:
The parsers MarkBind uses parses content in html tags as html
or markdown respectively.
This makes it difficult to add custom components that utilize
conflicting syntax.

Let’s add an interface to ignore content in certain special tags.
This interface is also exposed to plugins as the getSpecialTags option.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement lazy page building for markbind serve (#1038)
commitResults.messageBody:
During live reload, changes to a source file rebuilds all files that are
dependent on it.

In addition, rebuilding all dependent source files slows the live reload
process, leading to a less pleasant user experience.

In addition, when running markbind serve, all pages are built and
rendered initially.
This significantly slows down the time to first page load, which can
be substantial when the number of source files is huge.

Let's implement lazy page building in these operations, which is opt-in
using the existing -o <file> or --one-page <file> flags for the markbind
serve command.

Changes to a source file will only rebuild pages that are dependent on
it, and is currently being viewed by the author. Other pages not being
viewed by the author are rebuilt when the author navigates to them.
In addition, only the landing page is built initially when serving.
Subsequent pages are built when the author navigates to them.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix refactor to processDynamicResources (#1092)
Fix flex shrink not applying in content wrapper (#1135)
Unify markdown-it parser variants (#1056)
commitResults.messageBody:
The markdown-it parser used for attributes in components
uses a different set of plugins from the one used throughout markbind.

Let's unify the two variants to reduce the potential amount of
maintainence needed, and standardise the usable markdown
syntax throughout markbind.

commitResults.messageTitle: Simplify baseUrl resolving process (#1087)
commitResults.messageBody:
BaseUrls for static includes are rendered once during pre-processing
and another time during resolveBaseUrls.
The rebaseReference subroutine used during resolveBaseUrls also has
some unnecessary complexity.
In addition, in calculateNewBaseUrls, the relative baseUrl for doubly
nested subsites are not resolved correctly.

Let’s remove the rendering during pre-processing, unifying where baseUrl
is resolved for statically included content.
Let’s also refactor the rebaseReference method, simplifying its logic.
At the same time, we can standardise usages of the calculateNewBaseUrls
method to calculateImmediateParentSitePath, and fix the relative baseUrl
returned for doubly nested subsites.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow special tags to be self-closing (#1101)
commitResults.messageBody:
Unlike the html script and style special tags, plugin authors may want
injected special tags to be able to be self-closing as well.
This can help unify the syntax used in the plugin, which makes for
better author usability of the plugin.

Let’s allow injected special tags to be self-closing.
Let’s also do so for the script and style tags, which would be
expanded to their normal form after rendering.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test files (#1138)
Fix lazy reload for urls without index (#1110)
commitResults.messageBody:
Lazy live reloading uses the file extension of the request url to
determine whether the request is for a html page, and not from a
dynamic include.
Hence, requests for index.html with urls that do not end with
index.html fail to be detected.

Let’s add extra processing to detect such requests.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow an array for specifying page src or glob (#1118)
commitResults.messageBody:
The site configuration does not allow using an array for specifying
pages in the src or glob property.
The method for collecting the addressable pages can also be
made slightly simpler in the process.

Let’s do so, reducing the amount of repeated configuration the
author potentially needs to write.
Let’s also simplify the method for collecting addressable pages
in the process.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix baseUrl not working in include src attribute (#1088)
commitResults.messageBody:
While pre-processing includes or panels, we have not yet resolved
the baseUrl of the src attribute.
This causes markbind to fail in finding the source file, since baseUrl
remains in the src attribute.

Let’s resolve the baseUrl for such cases first, allowing the user to use
the baseUrl attribute in include and panel src attributes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Normalize inline puml line ending before hashing (#1174)
Expand test extensions and fix whitespace checks (#1156)
commitResults.messageBody:
The diffing utilities used for functional tests only check for
differences in html files and the siteData json file.
Additionally, the diffs are whitespace and newline insensitive, which
can cause subtle, unintended changes to go unnoticed.

Let's expand the range of files to diff, using the isTextOrBinary
package as a first guard against diffing binary files.
Let's add additional constants that guard against binary files not
recognised by the package, or misrecognised as such.

Let's also change the diffing function used to be whitespace and
newline sensitive.
Since whitespaces and newlines now appear in the diffs, let's also
improve the diff printing utilities to account for it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Standardise code style and remove eslint disables (#1180)
Allow variable tags to contain malformed xml (#1193)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the special tags patch, variables are able to contain custom
content possibly containing malformed xml.

Let’s add variable to the list of special tags to do so.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add SiteConfig model (#1175)
commitResults.messageBody:
The undefined properties of the site configuration object of Site are
lazily initialised throughout site generation.
This decreases the maintainability of site configuration logic.

Let’s consolidate all such initialisation to a new SiteConfig model.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix several b-modal selector names (#1218)
commitResults.messageBody:
The bootstrap vue migration causes modal elements to be transformed into
b-modal.

Let’s change the leftover selector names to match the new name.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant and unused variables (#1223)
Remove expressive layouts code duplication (#1225)
Simplify site nav generation (#1221)
commitResults.messageBody:
The site nav generation algorithm is heavily recursive.

Let's remove the recursion in favour of a simple iterative process.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak site navigation design (#1222)
Update variable documentation (#1203)
commitResults.messageBody:
The limitation of variables not being able to contain incomplete or
malformed xml has been patched.
Some areas of the variable documentation can also be formatted with
newly introduced features to be more visually appealing.

Let’s update the user guide to reflect the patch, and reformat some
areas of the variable documentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix site nav highlight and padding (#1242)
commitResults.messageBody:
Needing to start content without padding in the site navigation menu is
a rare use case. Let's revert the padding removal from the site nav.

The site nav supports adding custom content in between navigation items
as a markdown list item, but erroneously applies the highlight and
click wrapper.
Let's not apply the wrapper when there is no anchor or nested list in
said list item to rectify this.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update ignore configs for /vue-strap merge
commitResults.messageBody:
Vue-strap enables coverage reporting for snapshot tests.

The linting and jest configurations need to be updated as well to
isolate linting and tests to their original repos as well.

Let's add the coverage folder to .gitignore to avoid large coverage
diffs. Let's also update the eslint, stylelint and jest configurations
to ignore the appropriate folders.

Some vue component no longer exist that are still in the .eslintrc file
as well.
Let's remove these.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update developer guide for /vue-strap merge
Fix padding and font weight for custom list items (#1254)
commitResults.messageBody:
Padding and font weight formatting are not applied for custom list
items without nested lists or anchors.

Let's add these, and rename the classes used for better naming
consistency.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move components package to packages/vue-components
Fix puml plugin spawning zombie jvm processes (#1245)
commitResults.messageBody:
Asynchronously executing the puml child process results in zombie jvm
processes as there are multiple callbacks attached to it and page
generation is heavily callback based.

Let's break page generation into chunks, which allows node to clean up
the zombie processes in a timely fashion.

Let's also change the generated image's path to resolve from the
location of it's definition (ie. the file where the <puml> tag is
used), to reduce the amount of jvms spawned through including the same
file multiple times.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak box styles and revamp box code (#1268)
commitResults.messageBody:
The box component has numerous possible styles which relies heavily on
highly cascaded classes' styles.
This introduces a high degree of coupling between the classes. Also, as
a result of the cascading, some classes are rendered but completely
overwritten by others, making them redundant.

Let's revamp the box template and code to fix this.
We centralize the dynamic styles of each element into computed
properties, and extract helper methods to make these computed
properties as lean as possible.

Also, the component was already heavily rewritten prior to this. Hence,
let's remove it from the eslint ignore list to achieve consistent code
styling.

While revamping the code, let's tweak the box styles a little as well:
- Add some more padding for the header wrapper to better accomodate
markdown taking up a lot of space.
- Use the bootstrap 'primary' coloring for definition type boxes,
providing better visual diversity.
- Separate the applying of colors to the content wrapper and icon
wrapper. In so doing, the color attribute applies only to the content
(#1234), and seamless boxes' content correctly inherit color (#1233).
- Use the lighter `text-xx` bootstrap classes for seamless boxes'
coloring instead which are more suitable against a common white
background than the overly dark `alert-xx` classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move lots of things to the core package (#1272)
commitResults.messageBody:
Move non-cli functionalities to @markbind/core

The cli package houses numerous key functionalities in site generation,
such as the Site and Page models, assets, plugins and unit tests
belonging to files in @markbind/core.

Let's move all non-cli related functionality to the @markbind/core
package instead.
This encourages markbind-cli to focus solely on the cli aspect of
the application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert file permission changes (#1281)
Bump Vue.js from 2.5.16 to 2.6.11 (#1282)
Remove code fence wrap on hovering (#1288)
Remove deprecated syntax from default template (#1290)
Touch up user guide questions section (#1286)
Bump font-awesome from 5.13.1 to 5.14.0 (#1292)
Use es6 default export for vue-components (#1298)
Enable linting for several vue-components files (#1299)
commitResults.messageBody:
Several files in the vue-components package have undergone heavy
modifications since porting from yuche/vue-strap.

Let's enable html and js linting for these files to standardise code
style as such.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use tree-shaked BootstrapVue components (#1300)
commitResults.messageBody:
Only three components - modals, popovers and tooltips, rely on the
BootstrapVue library. The BootstrapVue dist is also rather large, at
358kb.

Let's tree shake the library and bundle it together with the
vue-components package as such.
This also makes for better cohesion of vue components.

In addition, the script tag referencing the polyfill dependency of
BootstrapVue and the components bundle was placed at the very bottom.
This increases FOUC, as the browser loads the bundles unnecessarily
only after the entire page has loaded.

Let's move the script tags up to the <head> tag hence.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused files in vue-components (#1302)
Add 'vue' to vue-components externals (#1305)
commitResults.messageBody:
BootstrapVue imports the vue library in its source code, causing vue
to also be included in the vue-components bundle.

Let's add it to the webpack externals config, resulting in further
savings of 70kb + 180kb over using the full BootstrapVue bundle.

commitResults.messageTitle: Build components bundle before deploying devGuide (#1317)
Fix README.md link (#1318)
Fix user guide b-btn usage (#1319)
commitResults.messageBody:
With bootstrap-vue tree shaken, b-btn components no longer work.

Let's change the user guide's buttons to simple anchor tags accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change number emoji to use unicode characters (#1016)
Use path.join instead of string interpolation (#1052)
commitResults.messageBody: Assuming forward slashes may cause errors on windows systems

commitResults.messageTitle: Add language indicator to code blocks (#957)
Documentation for Implement no-* attributes for <box>  (#1042)
Add heading and line highlighting to code blocks (#1034)
Add warnings for conflicting/deprecated component attribs (#1057)

Update tests for 2.13.1 (#1169)
Fix links in contributing.md (#1170)
commitResults.messageBody: Fix baseurl to baseUrl and added Code of Conduct to siteNav

commitResults.messageTitle: User Guide: Update members in About Us (#1186)
Remove duplicate code in syntax doc (#1168)
Add and organise tests for code blocks (#1143)
Replace console with logger (#1207)
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace console with logger

A follow up to #1057.
Let us also remove the error handler instance var
And directly use logger instead

commitResults.messageTitle: Mention development environment prerequisites in DG (#965)
Remove dependency on EJS (#990)
commitResults.messageBody:
MarkBind is using two templating engines (i.e. EJS and Nunjucks) while
Nunjucks is essential to the functionality since it's user accessible,
EJS seems a bit redundant and can be fully replaced by Nunjucks.

* Re-write page.ejs with Nunjucks grammar
* Make necessary changes to remove dependency on EJS
* Change test on nested variable reference as initial Nunjucks renderer
  is set to not auto-escape

commitResults.messageTitle: Adopt ES6 class syntax (#979)
doc: Update seamless style boxes (#1019)
Make the position of top navbar fixed (#982)
Support markdown for header attr in dropdown (#1029)
Fixed navbar no longer covers modals (#1070)
Update documentation on icon slot for boxes (#1123)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Update documentation on icon slot for boxes

* Update the examples for using icon slot for boxes.

* Resolve comments.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update navbar doc (#1146)
Update devGuide.md (#1158)
Add JSDoc for pageconfig (#1039)
Add class support for octicons (#1122)
Move preprocessThumbnails to componentParser
Add notes on merging conflicts (#1192)
commitResults.messageBody: * Update docs/devGuide/maintainerGuide.md

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix anchor navigation in panel headers (#1191)
commitResults.messageBody:
To avoid dynamically injecting lots of dummy spans in a document with
many headings, let's generate these spans at build time.

To make anchor navigation function properly on panel headers, let's
introduce ::before element to card-container to make space for the
fixed top nav.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make highlighting effective for code-formatted text (#1215)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently the background color of code tag is opaque, therefore the
highlighting will be covered by the code-formatted text. Let's
introduce transparency to code tag style when it's placed under
mark tag so that highlighting is effective in this case.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix expected help message to show header (#946)
docs: Fix inconsistent navigation links whitespace (#1018)
Add help usage to user guide (#996)
